intro: Meibomia pabularis, commonly known as the small meibomia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, simple leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth or along stream banks. Meibomia pabularis is often found in areas with high humidity and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-rich soils.
